content: forsinard shawl this shawl pattern is perfect for adventurous beginner knitters who want to try out some new stitches and advance their knitting skills the shawl starts with a basic garter tab cast on and then work forward using increasingly complex stitches i worked the sample shawl in 3 colours but you can use as many colours as you like diving into your stash materials yarn 3 skeins of estelle yarns eco tweed dk this yarn has 350 m per skein and knits more like a sport weight yarn mc = leaf 350 m or 385 y cc1 = charcoal 190 m or 210 y cc2 = silver 140 m or 155 y a minimum of 4 stitch markers needle 3 75 mm us 5 circular needle you can vary the wire length to accommodate the number of stitches as the shawl grows but it will be good to have a 32 - 40 wire to accommodate the final number of stitches gauge 18 sts for 4 in stockinette after blocking although gauge is not crucial to this project finished dimensions after blocking wingspan = 67 170 cm depth = 28 71 cm if you would like a larger shawl i suggest using a heavier dk weight yarn and 4mm us 6 needle notes the centre stitch in this shawl will have a marker on each side throughout the construction and it will always be worked as a slipped stitch with the yarn in back s1wyib on the right side and a p1 on the wrong side each right side row will always increase the stitch count by 4 using right and left leaning increases m1l insert the left-hand needle from front to back under the bar between the stitches thus lifting it onto the left-hand needle then knit this bar through the back loop so that the stitch is twisted and doesn t leave a hole m1r insert the left-hand needle from back to front under the bar between the stitches thus lifting it onto the left-hand needle then knit this bar through the front loop so that the stitch is twisted and doesn t leave a hole garter tab cast-on using the mc cast on 3 sts and knit 7 row do not turn your work at the end of the 7th row instead rotate your work 90 degrees and pick up and knit the 3 garter stitch bumps along the left hand side of your knitting so you will have 6 stitches on the needle next turn your work towards the bottom and pick up and knit the 3 cast on stitches for a total of 9 sts setup row ws k3 pm p1 pm p1 pm p1 pm k3 section 1 introducing your colours in this section we are going to use all 3 of the colours making easy garter stitch stripes to introduce cc1 and cc2 there are two types of stitches used in this sections stockinette and garter stripe and each is worked over
